metadata.Title: CVE-2021-27365 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.11.3. Certain iSCSI data structures do not have appropriate length constraints or checks, and can exceed the PAGE_SIZE value. An unprivileged user can send a Netlink message that is associated with iSCSI, and has a length up to the maximum length of a Netlink message. Adam Nichols discovered that heap overflows existed in the iSCSI subsystem in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-27365` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-185-generic - 3.13.0-185.236
linux-image-3.13.0-185-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-185.236
linux-image-3.13.0-185-lowlatency - 3.13.0-185.236
linux-image-3.13.0-185-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-185.236
linux-image-3.13.0-185-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-185.236
linux-image-3.13.0-185-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-185.236
linux-image-3.13.0-185-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-185.236
linux-image-3.13.0-185-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-185.236
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-185-generic - 3.13.0-185.236
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-185-lowlatency - 3.13.0-185.236
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
